channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9346] HBCK should provide an option to check if regions boundaries are the same in META and in stores.
item.description: If META don't have the same region boundaries as the stores files, writes and read might go to the wrong place. We need to provide a way to check that withing HBCK.
item.summary: HBCK should provide an option to check if regions boundaries are the same in META and in stores.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch will come soon.

Here is an exemple of the output.


Region's boundaries not alligned between stores and META for:

Patch for 0.94 attached. Just if someone want to have a look. Not yet tested. Just doing the detection for now. Will upload trunk when 0.94 will be tested.

OK. Seems to be working fine in 0.94. Did some cleanup. I will merge that to Trunk and upload a patch.

Trunk version attached. Tried the 0.94 version only. But there are mostly the same.

RegionBoundariesInformation can be private.

There're long lines in checkRegionBoundaries()

Please remove the space between method name and ().

Do you need to instantiate RegionBoundariesInformation in every iteration of the loop ?


+              HFile.Reader reader = HFile.createReader(fs, storeFile.getPath(), new CacheConfig(getConf()));

Can you close the reader at the end of the inner loop ?
Thanks for looking at it Ted. Attached it the updated version taking into consideration all your comments.

This message is automatically generated.
Can you check the findbugs warning ?

+ if (reader.getFirstKey() != null) if ((storeFirstKey == null)
+ || (comparator.compare(storeFirstKey, reader.getFirstKey()) < 0))
+ storeFirstKey = reader.getFirstKey();

Here you want to get the smallest first key across all files right? Does this compare <0 gives that? Similar below with storeLastKey
Two ifs in one line.. Bit difficult to read.. Can you format that pls?

void setRegionBoundaries() -> Method name can be better? say setRegionBoundariesCheck? Who calls this setter?

+ ByteArrayComparator comparator = new ByteArrayComparator();
Can directly use Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR ?

Thanks a lot for looking at it Anoop Sam John.

Attached updated version with all your comments addressed.

Here you want to get the smallest first key across all files right? Does this compare <0 gives that?

You are correct, and yes, it gives that.
Version without the long lines.

3 findbugs from this patch! Pls check once JM.
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8226//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html

So here is an updated version addressing Anoop's comments. Thanks Anoop.

1) Fixed findbug issues. 2 out of 3. Let's see what Hadoop QA will pop.
2) The comparator test was wrong. It worked for my tests because I had only a single store. But will have failed when there is more than one store for a region. Fixed.
3) For a reason I don't know, the reading of the parameter from the command line disappears between the versions. Restored it.

So will wait for findbug to see if it's better now...

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks JM for the updated patch.
One more small change needed.. Sorry I missed this in last comments set.


+        if ((currentRegionBoundariesInformation.storesLastKey != null)

+            && (currentRegionBoundariesInformation.metaLastKey != null)) {

+          valid = valid

+              && comparator.compare(currentRegionBoundariesInformation.storesLastKey,

+                currentRegionBoundariesInformation.metaLastKey) <= 0;

+        }

The storesLastKey can never be equal to metaLastKey right? It should be < metaLastKey... This can be changed on commit ? Ted are you going with the commit ?

Other than this +1.

Anoop:
My laptop is running low on battery. Please go ahead with commit.

Sure I will...
Lars fine with committing this to 0.94 branch.
Ping Stack for 0.96 and Andrew Purtell for 0.98
+1 for 0.96. Helps with operability – tools for fixup. Thanks.

For the <= 0 vs < 0 I think we should keep <= 0

The storesLastKey should almost never be equal to metaLastKey, but there is nothing to avoid that so it still can be.

If it's never equal, then <= will not hurt. If it is, then <= will be we good to have it.

I might be wrong But that's seems to be correct.

w.r.t. storesLastKey, I agree with Anoop.

BTW in patch v8 there is still some nested if statements, such as the following:


+              if (reader.getLastKey() != null) if ((storeLastKey == null)

+                  || (comparator.compare(storeLastKey, reader.getLastKey()) < 0))

+                storeLastKey = reader.getLastKey();

Strange for the nested if. I fixed it on the version 7. It's fix again in version 9.

Same as the < vs <=. Fixed too. I might have been thinking about something else when I did my last comment
